## Performance Comparison: Varying Data Sizes

```{r libraries, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(cluster)      # For K-Medoids (PAM)
library(factoextra)   # For visualization
library(ggplot2)      # For plotting
library(tictoc)       # For measuring execution time
```

```{r simulation-loop}
set.seed(42)

sizes <- seq(300, 10500, 200)
kmeans_times <- c()
kmedoids_times <- c()

for (n in sizes) {
  cat("Running for n =", n, "\\n")
  
  x <- c(rnorm(n/3, mean=0), rnorm(n/3, mean=3), rnorm(n/3, mean=6))
  y <- c(rnorm(n/3, mean=0), rnorm(n/3, mean=3), rnorm(n/3, mean=6))
  data <- data.frame(x, y)
  
  tic()
  kmeans(data, centers=3, nstart=10)
  kmeans_time <- toc(quiet = TRUE)
  kmeans_times <- c(kmeans_times, kmeans_time$toc - kmeans_time$tic)
  
  tic()
  pam(data, k=3)
  kmedoids_time <- toc(quiet = TRUE)
  kmedoids_times <- c(kmedoids_times, kmedoids_time$toc - kmedoids_time$tic)
}

```

```{r plot-times}
df_times <- data.frame(Size = sizes, KMeans = kmeans_times, KMedoids = kmedoids_times)

ggplot(df_times, aes(x = Size)) +
  geom_line(aes(y = KMeans, color = "KMeans")) +
  geom_line(aes(y = KMedoids, color = "KMedoids")) +
  labs(title = "Run Time vs Data Size", y = "Time (sec)", color = "Algorithm") +
  theme_minimal()
```

## Clustering on the Iris Dataset

```{r iris-cluster}
data(iris)
iris_data <- iris[, 1:2]  # Use only two features for visualization

kmeans_iris <- kmeans(iris_data, centers = 3, nstart = 10)
pam_iris <- pam(iris_data, k = 3)

iris$KMeansCluster <- as.factor(kmeans_iris$cluster)
iris$KMedoidsCluster <- as.factor(pam_iris$clustering)
```

### K-Means on Iris
```{r iris-kmeans-plot}
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = KMeansCluster, shape = Species)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(title = "K-Means Clustering on Iris Data") +
  theme_minimal()
```

### K-Medoids on Iris
```{r iris-kmedoids-plot}
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = KMedoidsCluster, shape = Species)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(title = "K-Medoids Clustering on Iris Data") +
  theme_minimal()
```
